storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view a dashboard of scheduling conflicts to manage them efficiently

testCases.title: Validate real-time display of scheduling conflicts
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Conflict dashboard is accessible
At least one active scheduling conflict exists in the system
User has necessary permissions to view conflict dashboard
System is connected to conflict detection logs

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict dashboard URL or menu option
steps.expectedResult: Conflict dashboard page loads successfully

steps.action: Observe the dashboard display
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays all current active scheduling conflicts with conflict details including resource names, time slots, and conflict types

steps.action: Note the timestamp of dashboard load
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads within 3 seconds with real-time conflict data

steps.action: Create a new scheduling conflict by double-booking a resource in the scheduling system
steps.expectedResult: New conflict is successfully created in the scheduling system

steps.action: Monitor the conflict dashboard for updates
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard automatically refreshes and displays the newly created conflict within 3 seconds without manual page refresh

steps.action: Verify the new conflict appears with all relevant details
steps.expectedResult: New conflict is visible with accurate information including resource, time, and conflict type

postconditions: Dashboard displays updated conflict list including the newly created conflict
All conflicts are visible and accessible for further action
System maintains real-time synchronization with conflict detection logs

testCases.title: Verify filtering and sorting functionality
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Conflict dashboard is loaded and displaying conflicts
Multiple conflicts exist with different resources, times, and severity levels
Filter and sort controls are visible on the dashboard
Test data includes conflicts across different resources and time periods

steps.action: Locate the filter section on the conflict dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Filter controls for resource, time, and type are visible and accessible

steps.action: Select a specific resource from the resource filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Resource filter is applied and dropdown shows selected resource

steps.action: Observe the dashboard conflict list
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays only conflicts associated with the selected resource, other conflicts are hidden

steps.action: Apply a time filter by selecting a specific date range
steps.expectedResult: Time filter is applied successfully

steps.action: Verify the displayed conflicts
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows only conflicts that match both the selected resource and time range filters, conflict count updates accordingly

steps.action: Clear the applied filters
steps.expectedResult: All conflicts are displayed again without any filters applied

steps.action: Locate the sort control and click on 'Sort by Severity'
steps.expectedResult: Sort option is activated and visual indicator shows sorting is applied

steps.action: Review the order of conflicts displayed
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are sorted correctly by severity level (e.g., High to Low or Low to High) with severity indicators clearly visible

steps.action: Verify the sorting order by checking severity levels of consecutive conflicts
steps.expectedResult: Each conflict in the list has equal or lower severity than the previous one, confirming correct sort order

postconditions: Dashboard maintains filter and sort settings until cleared by user
Filtered and sorted data is accurate and matches applied criteria
Dashboard remains responsive and functional after filtering and sorting operations

testCases.title: Test export of conflict reports
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Conflict dashboard is loaded with active conflicts displayed
Export button is visible on the dashboard
User has permissions to export conflict reports
Browser allows file downloads
At least one conflict exists in the system for export

steps.action: Locate the export button on the conflict dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Export button is visible and enabled on the dashboard interface

steps.action: Click the export button
steps.expectedResult: Export process initiates and browser shows download prompt or automatic download begins

steps.action: Wait for the file download to complete
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is successfully generated and downloaded to the default download location with a meaningful filename (e.g., conflict_report_YYYY-MM-DD.csv)

steps.action: Navigate to the download location and locate the exported CSV file
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is present in the download folder with correct file extension and non-zero file size

steps.action: Open the exported CSV file using a spreadsheet application or text editor
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully without errors

steps.action: Review the CSV file structure and headers
steps.expectedResult: CSV contains appropriate column headers such as Conflict ID, Resource, Time, Type, Severity, Status, etc.

steps.action: Verify the conflict data in the CSV file against the dashboard display
steps.expectedResult: All conflicts visible on the dashboard are present in the CSV file with accurate and complete data including resource names, timestamps, conflict types, and severity levels

steps.action: Check data formatting and readability in the CSV
steps.expectedResult: Data is properly formatted, dates and times are readable, and no data truncation or corruption is present

postconditions: CSV file remains available in download location for future reference
Dashboard remains functional and unchanged after export
Export action is logged in system audit trail
User can perform additional exports if needed

storyTitle: As Resource Manager, I want to visualize double booking conflicts to prioritize resolution

testCases.title: Validate visual display of double booking conflicts
preconditions: User is logged in with Resource Manager role
Resource conflict dashboard is accessible
At least one active double booking conflict exists in the system
User has necessary permissions to view resource conflict dashboard
System is connected to double booking conflict logs
Visual indicators and severity markers are configured

steps.action: Navigate to the resource conflict dashboard URL or menu option
steps.expectedResult: Resource conflict dashboard page loads successfully

steps.action: Observe the visual display of the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays current double booking conflicts in a visual format (e.g., timeline, calendar view, or graphical representation)

steps.action: Review the conflict details shown on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Each conflict displays resource details, timing information, severity indicators, and priority markers clearly

steps.action: Verify the visual indicators for conflict severity
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are color-coded or marked with visual indicators (e.g., red for high severity, yellow for medium, green for low) that are easily distinguishable

steps.action: Note the timestamp when dashboard is fully loaded
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads completely within 3 seconds with all visual elements rendered

steps.action: Create a new double booking conflict by scheduling the same resource for overlapping time slots
steps.expectedResult: New double booking conflict is successfully created in the system

steps.action: Monitor the resource conflict dashboard for automatic updates
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard automatically refreshes without manual intervention

steps.action: Verify the newly created conflict appears on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: New double booking conflict is displayed visually on the dashboard within 3 seconds with appropriate severity and priority indicators

steps.action: Confirm all conflict details are accurate for the new conflict
steps.expectedResult: New conflict shows correct resource name, overlapping time slots, conflict type, and visual severity markers

postconditions: Dashboard displays updated conflict list including the newly created double booking
All visual indicators are functioning correctly
System maintains real-time synchronization with double booking conflict logs
Dashboard remains responsive for further interactions

testCases.title: Verify filtering by resource type and date
preconditions: User is logged in with Resource Manager role
Resource conflict dashboard is loaded and displaying conflicts
Multiple double booking conflicts exist with different resource types and dates
Filter controls for resource type and date are visible on the dashboard
Test data includes conflicts across various resource types (e.g., rooms, equipment, personnel) and date ranges

steps.action: Locate the filter controls on the resource conflict dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Filter options for resource type and date are visible and accessible

steps.action: Click on the resource type filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown menu opens showing available resource types (e.g., Conference Rooms, Medical Equipment, Staff)

steps.action: Select a specific resource type from the dropdown (e.g., 'Conference Rooms')
steps.expectedResult: Selected resource type is highlighted and filter is applied

steps.action: Observe the conflicts displayed on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard shows only double booking conflicts for the selected resource type, other resource types are filtered out

steps.action: Verify the conflict count updates to reflect filtered results
steps.expectedResult: Conflict counter or summary shows the reduced number matching the filter criteria

steps.action: Locate the date filter control and click to open date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date picker or date range selector opens

steps.action: Select a specific date or date range for filtering
steps.expectedResult: Selected date range is applied and displayed in the filter control

steps.action: Review the displayed conflicts after applying date filter
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays only conflicts that match both the selected resource type and date range, all displayed conflicts fall within the specified date parameters

steps.action: Verify each displayed conflict matches the applied filter criteria
steps.expectedResult: All visible conflicts are of the selected resource type and occur within the selected date range, no conflicts outside the criteria are shown

steps.action: Clear one filter (e.g., resource type) while keeping the date filter active
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates to show conflicts of all resource types within the selected date range

steps.action: Clear all filters
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard returns to showing all double booking conflicts without any filtering applied

postconditions: Filter settings can be reapplied or modified as needed
Dashboard maintains accurate conflict display based on filter criteria
System performance remains within acceptable limits during filtering operations
All conflicts remain accessible when filters are cleared

testCases.title: Test integration with resolution tools
preconditions: User is logged in with Resource Manager role
Resource conflict dashboard is loaded with visible double booking conflicts
Resolution tools are configured and accessible
User has permissions to initiate resolution workflows
At least one double booking conflict is available for selection
Integration between dashboard and resolution tools is properly configured

steps.action: Identify a double booking conflict on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is visible with all details including resource, time, and severity

steps.action: Click or select the identified conflict
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is highlighted or selected, showing it is active for further action

steps.action: Locate the resolution action button or option (e.g., 'Resolve', 'Manage', or 'Open Resolution Tool')
steps.expectedResult: Resolution action button is visible and enabled for the selected conflict

steps.action: Click the resolution action button to initiate the resolution workflow
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and begins launching the resolution tool

steps.action: Wait for the resolution tool to open
steps.expectedResult: Resolution tool interface launches successfully in a new window, modal, or panel within 3 seconds

steps.action: Verify the resolution tool displays the selected conflict data
steps.expectedResult: Resolution tool is pre-populated with the selected conflict information including resource name, conflicting time slots, parties involved, and conflict details

steps.action: Check that all relevant conflict data is accurately transferred
steps.expectedResult: All data fields in the resolution tool match the conflict information displayed on the dashboard with no data loss or corruption

steps.action: Verify resolution options are available in the tool
steps.expectedResult: Resolution tool provides appropriate options for managing the conflict (e.g., reschedule, reassign resource, cancel booking)

steps.action: Confirm the integration maintains context and user session
steps.expectedResult: User remains logged in, session is maintained, and navigation back to dashboard is available

postconditions: Resolution tool is active and ready for conflict management
Selected conflict data is accurately loaded in the resolution tool
Dashboard remains accessible for returning after resolution
Integration between dashboard and resolution tools is confirmed functional
User can proceed with conflict resolution workflow
